Although it ends on the biggest cliffhanger in the history of bad writing, this game is an absolute emotional rollercoaster. Taking advantage of physics to gain the upper hand in combat or using semi-advanced tactics to get the drop on your enemy will always be satisfying. Add to that the best visuals that Half-Life has ever had, you get yourself one of the best experiences  in gaming. Overall this game is a must play, in the same way that if you haven't seen the original Star Wars trilogy you need to reevaluate your life.

This may be a controversial opinion, but vehicle sections are _awesome_. I wouldnâ€™t want to play a game exclusively made of them, but the variety, quality, and pacing of them here are what make this game for me.

Alyx is still cool and is with you for the whole game with natural dialog. The new hunters (The teal and gray things the trailer) are very welcome and fun to fight. The portal storm (The teal and gray thing in the trailer) is very welcome and is this games version of the (HL2/E1 Spoiler) [spoiler] Citadel, since, you know, the thing happened [/spoiler], and I love it. Also, that ending though!? I sure am excited to play the next one! Episode 3 here I come....
